summary: This is the amended and restated trust agreement for 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two,' dated March 8, 2002. It outlines the trust's purposes, including providing income to beneficiaries based on their earnings from 'bona fide employment' after Epstein's death, and details the powers and succession of trustees.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator and grantor of the trust, also serving as a trustee. The document outlines his intent for the trust to supplement beneficiaries' income from 'real jobs with real work'.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: Named as a trustee alongside Epstein. Authorized to designate or remove additional or successor trustees.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Appointed as a successor trustee to replace Jeffrey A. Schantz if Schantz resigns or ceases to act without having designated another.

persons.name: Paul Hoffman
persons.context: Notarized the execution of the trust amendment on March 8, 2002.

connections.description: Co-trustees of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two, jointly responsible for managing the trust assets and making distributions.
Schantz is authorized to designate successor trustees; Indyke is explicitly named as the successor if Schantz ceases to act without making a designation.
Epstein, as grantor, appoints Indyke as a successor trustee within the terms of the trust agreement.

events.title: Creation of Original Trust
events.description: The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two was originally created by a trust agreement on this date.

events.title: Trust Amendment and Restatement
events.description: The trust agreement was amended and restated, significantly detailing posthumous distribution rules to beneficiaries based on 'bona fide employment.'

keyFacts: The trust is designed to pay beneficiaries an amount equal to a percentage (starting at 200%) of their earnings from 'bona fide employment' after Epstein's death, with strict rules against 'no show' jobs.
Trustees Jeffrey E. Epstein and Jeffrey A. Schantz have 'sole and absolute discretion' to determine what constitutes bona fide employment, and their decisions are not subject to court review.
If a beneficiary attempts to thwart the grantor's intent by seeking distributions for non-bona fide earnings, they become ineligible for any future distributions from the trust.
Darren Indyke is named as the successor trustee if Jeffrey A. Schantz ceases to act without designating another.
The trust is governed by the laws of the United States Virgin Islands.
